DOC.detailed_description: Background : The propose study Regular Military service woman build extends fund VA HSR & D grant currently investigate similar objective Reserves National Guard ( R/NG ) service woman . This propose study address radically change DoD DVA health care delivery need two priority population : woman expose combat , woman sexually assault military . There limited understanding complex relationship traumatic exposure woman 's health outcome , post-traumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) subsequent health service use barrier care . Objectives : The objective : 1 ) To identify describe organizational , situational , individual risk factor physical sexual assault ( i.e. , victimization ) woman serve currently serve Regular Military Operation Enduring Freedom Operation Iraqi Freedom ( OEF/OIF ) deployment status ( deploy combat related region , deploy , serve non-combat related area outside continental United States ( US ) , serve within continental US . 2 ) To determine association PTSD , TBI , physical sexual assault OEF/OIF current physical mental health status health risk behavior deployment status . 3 ) To identify current internal external barrier DoD , DVA , civilian health service relationship woman 's deployment victimization status association PTSD TBI ; 4 ) To identify describe difference Regular Military R/NG population objective . Methods : We propose cross sectional study design two sequential phase . Phase 1 would include focus group refine current study interview specific Regular Military population . Phase 2 would involve identification successful interview 669 Regular Military service woman , use random sample stratification deployment status , state service accession , service branch . Building current study , woman select five state : Iowa , Illinois , Kansas , Missouri , Nebraska . Potential study participant mail information summary ask take part study assess deployment health military woman . 1058 woman contact obtain target 669 complete interview . Consenting participant ( 167 per deployment group ) complete telephone interview assess socio-demographic variable , trauma exposure , health history , current health status , military environmental factor ( organizational situational factor ) , military DVA health care barrier care , self report service use . Descriptive analysis multiple logistic regression analysis use . Implications : It unclear need military woman meet current combat-associated PTSD treatment originally base male population . It anticipate finding improve understand health risk outcomes deploy Regular Military service woman contrast woman serve R/NG ( PTSD TBI key outcome variable ) . Our result consequently implication DoD DVA evidence base intervention primary prevention care .
